value: Project for the top of a painted frame of an altar

label: Description
value: Two angels seated upon a socle on top of an entablature hold an escutcheon in which the dove is represented. "(C)VIVS/ (LIVORE) SANATI / (SU)MVS" (IS. c. 53, v. 5) is written on an escutcheon before the center of the entablature. Two women, probably representing sibyls, sit upon the corners.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink. Various water color washes; gold. Varnished. Pencil (added later). Paper

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brown, rose, green wash, black chalk Support: white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchase in memory of Mrs. John Innes Kane
Allegorical representation of the wedding of a member of the von Ringles family in Strasburg with a von Hengel

label: Description
value: Vertical oval within vertical rectangle. A man at left and a woman at right hold a clock at center. Over man's head a genius holds a shield with a rooster on a ring; over the woman's head another holds a shield with two crossed hoes. Conventionalized leaf border.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from the Mary Hearn Greims Fund

label: Description
value: Simulates a border of flowering nasturtiums with a background of a row of profusely berried twigs. At the base there is a band simulating a low scalloped wire fence. From house built in 1812 in Burlington, Vermont. Aesthetic style.

label: Description
value: A border of fleur-de-lis and both single and double roses, with a band at bottom simulating a low scalloped wire fence. Printed in red, olive, green, white and gilt on black field. Aesthetic style border

label: Provenance
value: From house built in 1812 in Burlington, Vermont.

label: Description
value: Flitter frieze with a continuous scroll design of alternating leaves suggestive of acanthus and large stylized flower. Identical bands top and bottom, the top band design is inverted: a three-petalled fleur-de-lis. Portions of design have lines of ground and gilded mica. To be used with 1946-17-5; gilded design with gilt mica and red wool flock field. Design embossed in pebble effect.

label: Physical description
value: Machine-printed paper, flocked, embossed, applied mica flakes

label: Description
value: Large stylized flower similar to 1946-17-4 with which this paper was used. Floral design is printed in red flock on a lighter red ground. From house built in 1812 in Burlington, Vermont.

label: Description
value: A conventionalized balanced design. A floral motif. The design is finely embossed with parallel lines while the entire outline is highly embossed in gilt and resembles tooled leather. Marked on margin is "3475".

label: Provenance
value: From house built in 1812 in Burlington, Vermont.

label: Description
value: Design inspired by a 17th century Genoese cut voided velvet. Slender acanthus leaves in ogival bands. Medallions contain axial motifs in stylized form. The design is embossed to simulate a variety of embroidery stitches and gives the appearance of being worked in gold thread, printed in gold on ivory field.

label: Description
value: The chair back with reeded posts; panelled top rail and reeded lower rail, enclosing the figure of a harp; out-curved front legs, lower half carved to depict fur-covered animals legs and paw feet; trapezoidal, dark blue slip seat in readed frame.

label: Description
value: Fragment consisting of alternating stripes with wave or cuttlefish motifs and feather motifs. Colors are two shades of tan, white, and rose. Fragment was found near Pachacamac.
Covered Goblet with Lilies of the Valley

label: Description
value: A covered stemmed goblet with scalloped petals covering body and lid with flower bud as finial.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from the Mary Hearn Greims Fund
Ornament Panel with Orpheus and the Judgment of Paris

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle showing fully decorated sheet with many figures, including two nymphs with birds, a roundel showing the Judgment of Paris and another showing Apollo playing the violin.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle fully decorated with symmetrical grotesque. At top, cameo profiles and horses. Below, a small battle frieze and a pair of bound prisoners.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: A vertical ornamental motif, bilaterally divided, shows a winged figure, holding trumpets and palm leaves, and supporting a bird cage. Upper level, two seated figures write on tablets that read S.P.Q.R. (The Roman Senate and People) and D.M.A.N.  Two bound captives sit beneath a military trophy. In the center of the panel, a winged figure supporting a birdcage holds trumpets and palm leaves, symbols of victory. At the top, two seated Roman senate and people. Two bound captives sit beneath a military trophy and above a small ornamental battle scene.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Upper part of the print depicts the musical contest between Apollo, playingthe lyre and Marsayas playing the bagpipes. In a narrow relief below, the flaying of Marsyas is depicted. Seated on a pedestal at bottom of the print two satyrs play musical pipes.In the relief above them, a satyr plays the pipes to a stag on the right, while Apollo chases Daphne on the left. Image is heavily ornamented with figures.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving on off white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Grotesque Ornament with Satyrs, from a set of twenty ornament panels

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle showing a symmetrical grotesque composition of arabesques, satyrs, lions and birds. At bottom, a mask. At top, a circular architectural structure.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle showing symmetrical grotesque composition. At top, putti wrestle two manticore. Below, a candelabrum motif, two goats, and a mask.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
Plate, from a series of designs for ewers and vessels

label: Description
value: A large snail shell on the body from which emerges a dragon biting the ankle of a man at left at the base of the handle. Three other bearded men and two snakes make up the handle, which is at left. A foot with a decoration of plant motifs.

label: Provenance
value: 1946: acquired by Museum (from Dr. William H. Schab)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane

label: Description
value: The handle is at upper right; a man is bound to it by a harness at his waist. On the right side of the body a man astride a grotesque mask supports on his shoulders another man who grasps the handle. Also astride masks are a putto, at center, and a bearded man with a shell, at left.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
Rinceaux Design with Putto, plate 3, from A New Book of Ornaments Useful to all Artists

label: Description
value: Cupid is supported at the center by rinceaux arising from two entwined cornucopias; attributes of music are in the left cornucopia, attributes of love in the right. Dark, hatched background. Bottom left: . Gribelin in. et Sculps; left, 3.

label: Provenance
value: Purchased in memory of Mrs. A. Murray Young; 1946: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. A. Murray Young
Design for a Knife Handle Showing Prudence

label: Description
value: Prudence is shown with a snake in an ovoid. A heart is depicted in a medalion above and two clasped hands are shown beneath the ovoid. A candelabra ornament motif sprouts from an urn at the bottom.

label: Provenance
value: Purchase in memory of Mrs. A. Murray Young

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. A. Murray Young
Design for a Knife Handle Showing Faith

label: Description
value: Faith is shown in an ovoid, holding a cross and a book; medallion as in 1946-33-1 at top. Ornament as in 1946-33-1.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving and etching on off-white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. A. Murray Young
Design for a Knife Handle Showing Charity

label: Description
value: Charity is shown in an ovoid, with two children; a pelican feeding her young is in the medallion at top. Ornament in the candelabra scheme rises from a flower basket at the bottom.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving and etching on off-white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. A. Murray Young
Design for a Knife Handle Showing One of the Virtues

label: Description
value: A woman representing one of the vrtues, holding a bird and a book(?), is shown in an ovoid; medalliion as in 1946-33-3. Ornament as in 1946-33-3.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving and etching on off-white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. A. Murray Young
The Sixth Knot, from Dürer's Six Knots

label: Description
value: On a black circular ground, a pattern of continuous knots, forming six roundels with open centers around a seventh, in which are the artist's initials (in monogram). From the circle, at the four corners of the plate are stylized tree forms, in black, on which are further knots and tendrils.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Pitcher with a Figure of Neptune, from "Insignae Ac Planè Novum Opis Cratero Graphicum (A New Artistic Work, Eminent and Clear, On the Vessel)

label: Description
value: A whale, on the lip of the pitcher, is about to swallow Jonah. On the body is a scene with sea monsters and sea gods, one of whom is carrying away a woman.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. A. Murray Young

label: Description
value: Design of six large medallions containing a scene from Lohengrin. Border around the cloth has interlacing bands forming circles and a lyre between confronted swans. Large monogram: E.S.H.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Jerome Alexander in memory of Gertrude Eleanor Alexander

label: Description
value: Narrow border ornamented with small four-petaled flowers. Medallions at either end show design of floral sprays in leaf border.

label: Description
value: Square handkerchief with a border of drawn work and corners decorated in a vine motif. Hemmed edges.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: piña (pineapple) fiber, cotton Technique: embroidered
